mcq_data.question: Which protocol is used to transfer web pages over the Internet?
mcq_data.solution: HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is used to transfer web pages.

mcq_data.question: Which of the following is an example of a search engine?
mcq_data.solution: Google is a search engine used to find information on the Internet.

mcq_data.question: What is the main purpose of DNS in the Internet?
options: To translate domain names into IP addresses
mcq_data.solution: DNS (Domain Name System) translates domain names into IP addresses.

mcq_data.question: Which of the following is not a web browser?
mcq_data.solution: Windows is an operating system, not a web browser.

mcq_data.question: What does URL stand for?
mcq_data.solution: URL stands for Uniform Resource Locator.

mcq_data.question: Which protocol is used for sending emails?
mcq_data.solution: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is used to send emails.

mcq_data.question: Which of the following is an example of cloud storage service?
mcq_data.solution: Google Drive is a cloud storage service.

mcq_data.question: What is the main function of a firewall?
mcq_data.solution: A firewall blocks unauthorized access while permitting legitimate communication.

mcq_data.question: Which of the following is an example of e-commerce?
mcq_data.solution: Buying books from Amazon is an example of online shopping, a form of e-commerce.

mcq_data.question: Which of the following allows real-time text and voice communication over the Internet?
mcq_data.solution: VoIP (Voice over Internet Protocol) allows real-time text and voice communication.
